author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Vilnius, a burdened bird of steel fell low,
By Germania's craft, its course did surely go.
The courier of DHL did meet its woe,
In Lithuania's embrace, a somber tale to sow.

Ukraine, like a vigilant shieldmaiden of old, 
Holds fiercely to Russia's land, her story boldly told.
She hopes the Trumpeter shall bring peace, a pact to enfold,
Beneath the Kursk's harsh skies, a saga of bravery unfolds.

In U.A.E., a seer was taken neath' the sun,
Zvi Kogan is his name, a sermon, sadly done.
An act of terror in hatred spun,
Israel mourns this darkest, unholy run.

feedItems.title: DHL Cargo Plane Crashes in Lithuania, Killing One
feedItems.description: A DHL cargo plane flying from Germany to Lithuania crashed near Vilnius airport, according to an airport spokesperson.

feedItems.title: Ukraine Clings to Shrinking Sliver of Russia, Expecting Trump to Push for Peace Talks
feedItems.description: Moscow’s forces have launched a massive counteroffensive to retake land in the Kursk region, a potential bargaining chip for Kyiv.

feedItems.title: Israel Says Rabbi Found Dead in U.A.E. Was Abducted and Killed
feedItems.description: Zvi Kogan was targeted in an “act of antisemitic terrorism,” Israeli authorities said.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the North where maples sway, a stalemate mounts, ne'er wrought away,
Mailmen of Canadian toil, embroiled in conflict, on native soil.
Negotiations led by the crown, yet peace in these talks, remains unfound.

Perished now, our jovial bard, Woolery of heart, deeply starred,
Invoking love with every word, upon 'Love Connection', ever heard.
In final notes, his temper flared, defiance held, not scared.

The U.N.'s pact, of great sums deal, to mend the Earth's breaking seal,
Yet shadows loom of orange hue, Trump's scorn may this pact undo.
A storm of change, the winds howl, amidst the uncertainty, silent owl.

feedItems.title: Canadian Postal Workers Strike Drags On as Talks Fail to Break Deadlock
feedItems.description: Canada Post and the Canadian Union of Postal Workers have met several times with a federal mediator in the last week in an effort to break a deadlock.

feedItems.title: Chuck Woolery, Host of 'Love Connection,' Dies at 83
feedItems.description: The genial TV host turned right-wing podcaster was an outspoken critic of the government’s pandemic response.

feedItems.title: U.N. Reaches $300 Billion Climate Financing Deal as Trump Looms
feedItems.description: The U.S. and others have agreed to triple their annual climate financing by 2035, but the incoming administration is expected to repudiate the deal.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In Beirut, the goat is seized by despair,
Amid the dragon’s fire, its peace torn from its lair.
The rabbit’s burrow crumbles, in violence we share,
To the cycle, the city returns, clad in chaos's wear.

War hound bays in Ukraine, towards the Russian bear,
With teeth of Western missiles, it dares to flare.
The snail's safe stone, in fear it leaves bare,
For the hound's reach now covers its once hidden lair. 

In U.A.E., the dog has lost its fellow mate,
Taken in silence, sealed is the rabbi’s fate.
The sparrow sings of fear, its song echoes late,
In lands afar, does the Israeli lamb await.

feedItems.title: War Between Hezbollah and Israel Drags Beirut Back Into Despair
feedItems.description: Lebanon’s capital city is returning to a cycle of violence and destruction just as it was beginning to stabilize after years of chaos.

feedItems.title: Ukraine's Western Missiles Threaten Big Russian Assets
feedItems.description: Russian airfields, ammo depots and training grounds are no longer safe. Hundreds of targets are now within reach of newly authorized weapons.

feedItems.title: Israeli Spy Agency Investigates Missing Jewish Community Leader in U.A.E.
feedItems.description: The disappearance of a Chabad rabbi prompts fears of Israeli citizens being targeted outside of Israel.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
'Tis Canada's scheme, a plot of cunning spun,
To trade with U.S., their trust thus won.
Yet Mexico, they'll toss beneath the wheel-ike bus,
Pray for them, St. Benedictus!

India, to China fair, a challenge bold doth set,
A chance in hand, on factory floor, a bet.
Trump in power, tariffs high, Chinese wares do cost,
In this game of trade, who hath lost?

Ukraine, with Western missiles, fires in earnest fray,
To build their own, they do assay.
But lack of coin and skill, constraints do take their toll,
In this struggle, may God save each soul!

feedItems.title: Canada's Plan for U.S. Trade Talks: Throw Mexico Under the Bus
feedItems.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has suggested his country could cut a deal with the U.S. without Mexico.

feedItems.title: To Challenge China, India Needs to Get Out of the Way of Its Factory Owners
feedItems.description: India has a fresh chance to become a manufacturing powerhouse with the election of Donald Trump, who has promised to levy sky-high import tariffs on Chinese goods.

feedItems.title: Ukraine Is Firing Western-Made Ballistic Missiles---and Starting to Build Its Own
feedItems.description: Yet Kyiv’s missile program lacks capacity and funding, which could limit its effectiveness.
